info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 6:31AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 631 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Munds Park, or 11 miles northeast of Sedona, moving northeast at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Tornado possible and wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Marshall Lake, Mormon Mountain, Mountainaire, Fisher Point, Munds Park, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Pine Flats, Slide Rock State Park, East Pocket Lookout Tower, Lower Lake Mary, Upper Lake Mary, Cosnino, West Fork of Oak Creek, Indian Gardens and Red Rock-Secret Mountain Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 204 and 208. Interstate 17 between mile markers 317 and 332. Route 66 near mile marker 204. State Route 89A between mile markers 378 and 387.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Manzanita Campground, Pine Flat Campground, Canyon Vista Campground, Cave Springs Campground, Pine Grove Campground, Canyon Vista Campground, Lake View Campground, Pine Flat Campground, Lakeview Campground and Fort Tuthill County Park.
This includes the following swimming holes... Slide Rock and Encinoso.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT MUNDS PARK TO MOUNTAINAIRE IN YAVAPAI AND COCONINO COUNTIES UNTIL 7 AM MST

area.areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
